intro: Polygonum lanceolatum, commonly known as narrowleaf knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features upright stems that are often reddish in color and covered with fine hairs. The leaves are lanceolate, hence the species name, and are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, blooming in late summer. This plant is often found in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks.
